fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While the Atlassian Cloud app within Okta does now provide a Statuspage chiclet, you are not provided with an example URL from Atlassian on what to submit while setting up the app in Okta. 

Atlassian provides examples for services like Jira (https://[your-subdomain].atlassian.net) and Confluence (https://[your-subdomain].atlassian.net/wiki) but nothing is provided to customers looking to configure it for Statuspage. Maybe the issue is that the management URL is not on an Atlassian domain? 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# setup Atlassian cloud Okta app 
# provide a URL for the Statuspage chiclet to point to manage.statuspage.io in order to be taken to the management console 
# get dumped at https://manage.statuspage.io/login
# type in email address again (defeating purpose of SSO id-init flow) 
# get into management portal 

h3. Expected Results

The Statuspage chiclet in okta authenticate, and direct, you to the Statuspage management portal (manage.statuspage.io) 

h3. Actual Results

The IdP flow directs you to https://manage.statuspage.io/login where you are forced to enter your email address, instead of being sent into the management portal. 

h3. Workaround

Customers can provide the below URL (replacing the cloud site info section from the example) when setting up the chiclet. This will allow for expected behavior when doing an IdP init session - 

manage.statuspage.io/cloud/atlassian-cloud-site-id

While this does solve the issue, it is not convenient to find a given Atlassian site URL, and is not provided in the existing Atlassian Cloud Okta app setup documentation: https://saml-doc.okta.com/SAML_Docs/How-to-Configure-SAML-2.0-for-Atlassian-Cloud.html
fields.summary: Atlassian Cloud Okta APP is not working for Statuspage IdP-init SSO

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On the invite dialog, you can un-flag the *Send Email* checkbox. Even though this feature works, accounts invited in this way might show the *Invitation email not sent* badge, even if you choose to re-send. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access your Instance administration.
# Click on *Invite users*, on the top right corner.
# Add a user email on the top.
# Expand the *Personalise email invite*.
# Un-check *Send email*.
# Click on *Invite user*.
# Then, on this user's profile, click on *Resend*.

h3. Expected Results
The *Invitation email not sent* message shouldn't be displayed anymore, as you have triggered the invite.

h3. Actual Results
The *Invitation email not sent* is still visible. If the user accepts the invitation through the message, the *Resend* button won't be visible anymore, but the *Invitation email not sent* would still be there.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Invite a user without sending the email invite is not working properly.

fields.description:
Currently, if the user creates an Atlassian account using a company domain that has been verified they are automatically migrated to a managed account and lose the ability to change their email address. 

It will be great if the user has the ability to review the migration first or to accept/reject the migration before we migrate them to managed account.
fields.summary: Ability to review managed account migration.

fields.description:
With the recent improvements in the G Suite integration described here [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2020/10/were-improving-g-suite-settings-get-ready-for-better-user-management-and-security], when having an Atlassian Access the integration allows you to select specific groups to sync.

Suggestion: Improve the selection of which groups are synced from G Suite to allow for automatic assignment. Example: groups in G Suite are automatically synced based on group name containing some pre-defined value (e.g. group name starts with _atlassian-_)

This feature already exists in User Provisioning ([example for okta|https://help.okta.com/en/prod/Content/Topics/users-groups-profiles/usgp-enable-group-push.htm])
fields.summary: G Suite automatic selection of groups to sync

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Under People menu, users can still invite external users to site even that the options are disabled from the Site Access configuration page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Remove all the abilities to invite external users at the Site Administration under Site Access configuration page
# Inside the instance, under the People option at the navigation bar, there is an option to invite a teammate

h3. Expected Results
Users should not be able to invite external users if the Site Access setting is set that Users are unable to send invitations.

h3. Actual Results
Users can invite external users and request access, ignoring the Site Access configuration.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Under People menu, users can still invite external users to site even that the options are disabled from the Site Access configuration page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users having a non-ASCII characters in their full name are affected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Visit https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility
# Change your *Full name* to "Multibyte こんにちは ä Here"

**  !Screen Shot 2021-04-07 at 11.23.22.png|thumbnail!  
**  !Screen Shot 2021-04-07 at 11.43.02.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The full name shows as entered.

h3. Actual Results

You will see the garbled full names across the Atlassian Cloud services.

h3. Workaround
