fields.description:
Hi, I am using the latest Atlassian mobile app and still having problem login. The error message is:

No Available apps:

There are no apps currently configured on this device that your organization allows to open this content.

Please ensure you are signed in with your work or school account to your managed apps or contact your IT helpdesk.

I am able to sign in directly via managed browser, but not from the app.
fields.summary: Jira Mobile Android - "No Available apps" message when logging in Microsoft Intune environment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the landing product is changed, users without access to the configured product will not be redirected to the dashboard in order to use the application navigator to access the product that they have access to, as stated on the [article to change the landing product|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/set-your-sites-landing-product]:
{quote}(i) If one of your users doesn't have access to the landing product, we'll land them on the dashboard of that product but they won't be able to access any content. They can, however, change to another product using the product switcher in the navigation menu.
{quote}
Instead, these accounts will face a message that they do not have access to the site.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a site with both Jira and Confluence.
 # [Invite a user|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/invite-a-user/] and grant access to a single product only (either Confluence or Jira). This product must not be the landing one.
 # As a site-admin, go to the site's administration and access the *Product access* part.
 # There, under the *What you need to know* session, tap the *Change this setting* button and select a product.
 # Have the user accessing the site's URL (example.atlassian.net).


 (i) Although the default message states that the landing product is Jira, by tapping the option to change the default product, the dropdown will prompt you to select a product:
 # !default.png|thumbnail!

If you have already configured a product, after tapping this option, it will look like the following, already having the product selected:

!changed.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The user should be redirected to the product's dashboard, allowing the application navigator to be used.
h3. Actual Results

The user will face a message that they don't have access to the landing product:
{quote}account@example.com doesn't have access to Jira/Confluence on example.atlassian.net
{quote}
h3. Workaround

Have the user manually accessing the site's URL with a context path:
 * For Confluence (example.atlassian.net/wiki)
 * For Jira (example.atlassian.net/jira)
fields.summary: Changing the landing product does not redirect users to its dashboard

fields.description: Users may have 2FA enabled in Google. This makes users verify the account multiple times. The org admin should have the option to disable the new verification that is done by Atlassian.
fields.summary: Disable account verification when users signing with Google

fields.description:
Currently, we do not have a single endpoint that can help us create a user and give him product + role access in one go itself.

Having an API call that could achieve this would help make the process faster.
fields.summary: A single API call that can help to create a user and assign appropriate group and product access

fields.description:
Ability to have 24 hour time format on Profile and visibility (https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility)
 
 !Screenshot 2021-03-23 at 18.38.15.png|thumbnail! 

Updating a 24-hour format should reflect in Jira fields as well.
fields.summary: Ability to have 24 hour time format on Profile and visibility

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

During a new user invitation process if you select multiple groups for the user at the *Group membership* section, only one group is displayed at the UI instead of all groups that the user will receive.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Admin hub (https://<instance>.atlassian.net/admin)
 # Click on *Users* > *Invite users*
 # Add multiple groups to the *Group membership* section

h3. Expected Results

The groups that are added are displayed one next to the other during the invitation process.
h3. Actual Results

Only one group is displayed even if you have multiple groups selected for the user. If the invitation is completed the user will receive all groups.

Selecting multiple groups:

!image 1.png|thumbnail!

The result is:

!image 2.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

You can add the user without groups, and after the invite, relate the user to the groups.
fields.summary: During the invite only one group is displayed at the group membership even if multiple groups are selected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It is possible to deactivate a managed account using the [Disable a user REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-management/rest/api-group-users/#api-users-account-id-manage-lifecycle-disable-post]. However, performing this action doesn't generate a log on the Audit Logs.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access one Organisation that has access to the Org Audit Logs (either by having an Access subscription or a Premium subscription of its products).
# Generate an admin API key.
# Use this API key to deactivate a user.
# Now, navigate to the Org Audit Logs.

h3. Expected Results
The event should be logged on the Audit Log, so admins could understand how the account got deactivated.

h3. Actual Results
This action doesn't generate any log on the Audit Logs.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Deactivating an account through the API doesn't generate a log on the Org Audit Logs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While configuring SAML with auth0 IDP, a user cannot save SAML configuration on the Atlassian organization. 
This happens only with organizations with flexible authentication policies enabled.
IDP auth0 provides Entity id in URN format: "urn:TENANT.auth0.com."
Refer [auth0|https://auth0.com/docs/protocols/saml-configuration-options/enable-saml2-web-app-addon] documentation.
Saving configuration with URN format returns "Error: issuer must be a valid URL."
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open SAML configuration page on the organization that has flexible auth policies enabled.
 # Enter Entity id in URN format, some sample SSO URL, public certificate, and save configuration:

{noformat}
Identity provider Entity ID => urn:TENANT.auth0.com
Identity provider SSO URL => [https://TENANT.auth0.com/samlp/APP_ID]{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

SAML configuration should get saved.
h3. Actual Results

SAML configuration does not get saved with the below exception thrown in the console logs:
{noformat}
"code":"BAD_REQUEST_FORMAT","message":"Error: issuer must be a valid URL"}
{noformat}
h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Unable to save SAML configuration while integrating with auth0 IDP

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary



Unable to update the Idle session duration. The only option available is 30 days, and the dropdown does not work.
In an attempt to enter the value manually, the page disappears. The issue affects organizations both with and without Authentication policies enabled.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to admin.atlassian.com
 # Navigate to Security --> Idle session duration (or to Security -> Authentication policies -> *Edit* authentication policy).
 # Try updating the session duration.

h3. Expected Results

Should be able to update session duration.
h3. Actual Results

No dropdown value is presented for updating session duration. No exception or error is seen on UI.
h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Unable to update the Idle session duration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement:

Currently, the portal-only accounts have a default session timeout of 30 days. Only managed accounts can be enforced a custom session time out duration.
h3. Solution Suggested:

Extend this feature out to portal-only accounts as well
fields.summary: Provide the ability to change the default session time out for JSM portal-only customer accounts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Org APIs cannot be used on the managed accounts that are unverified. 

https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-management/rest/api-group-users/#api-users-account-id-manage-profile-get


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to edit the name of an unverified account via API

h3. Expected Results

As working in the managed account UI, the rename for the unverified accounts should be allowed via API.

h3. Actual Results

The API calls fail and doesn't seem to recognize the unverified account as a managed account.
{code}
$ curl --request PATCH   --url 'https://api.atlassian.com/users/<AAID_ UnverifiedAccount>/manage/profile' 

{"key":"forbidden","context":"Error: Caller must be an org admin of targeted account or be the targeted account","errorKey":"forbidden","errorDetail":"Error: Caller must be an org admin of targeted account or be the targeted account"
{code}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Org API does not work for unverified accounts

fields.description:
Microsoft Cloud App Security (MCAS) currently doesn’t support Atlassian Cloud products. By the nature of MCAS (proxying cloud products URLs) - in order for it support Atlassian Cloud, Atlassian needs to make changes in our Identity Platform.

This feature request suggests the improvement of the authentication method, allowing devices enrolled with it to authenticate to our products.
fields.summary: Support authentication on devices enrolled with Microsoft Cloud App Security (MCAS)

fields.description:
Currently, when a new user signs up to Atlassian with an email that belongs to a Managed domain, no Notification gets triggered to the Org Admin informing about this change.

Org Admins have to explicitly monitor the Managed Accounts section to check for the accounts that get created via self sign up.

It would be nice if we have a way to notify Org Admins about when a new Managed account gets created so that they can give them the correct SSO permissions on the IDP or add them to a non-SSO Auth policy.
fields.summary: Notification to be triggered to Org Admins when a new Managed account gets created via Self Sign up.

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Bug Fix Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

The link in the "Change your Atlassian account profile details" email is outdated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # A site admin to submit "Suggest changes" from *User Management*
 ** !Screen Shot 2021-03-08 at 12.54.57.png|thumbnail! 
 # The user opens the link in the received email
 ** !Screen Shot 2021-03-08 at 13.05.41.png|thumbnail! 
 # Check the link redirects you to *start.atlassian.com* but not the profile page

h3. Expected Results

The correct link in the email should be https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile?suggestChangeDetails=true, but not https://id.atlassian.com/manage?suggestChangeDetails=true. Preferably, the link is better to be https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/email when the suggest is about email change.

h3. Actual Results

The link in the email leads you to *start.atlassian.com* which is not a page for profile changes.

h3. Workaround

There are 2 options currently available:

* Let the user manually visit https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/ to change their profile, or
* Subscribe [Atlassian Access|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/make-changes-to-a-managed-user-account/] so that the organization admin can apply the changes to the managed accounts.

Also consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Suggest changes email link is broken

fields.description:
h3.Summary

By default, [managed accounts|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/what-are-managed-accounts/] have the following profile information displayed at the organization level, which can be also synced via [user provisioning|https://support.atlassian.com/provisioning-users/docs/understand-user-provisioning/]:

* Full name
* Email address
* Job title
* Department
* Based in

From these profile details, only the following ones are synced from the organization to the user management part of the site administration:

* Full name
* Email address
* Job title

(i) Other information such as *Local time*, *Public name*, *Based in*, *Job title* will be retrieved directly from the user's profile in https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility. Even though those can be retrieved via provisioning to the organization as well, they can be overwritten by the user due to ID-7396.

h3.Suggestion
This is a suggestion to sync all user details from the organization to the user management of the site, including the ones being retrieved via user provisioning. For example:

* Department
* Organization
* Timezone
* Preferred language
fields.summary: Sync additional profile information from the organization to the site administration

fields.description:
As per this article https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/manage-an-organization-with-the-admin-apis, the admin key can last from a week up to a year. Currently, no email notification is sent when the key expires or is about to expire. 

The suggestion is to send a reminder notification to the organization admins some time prior to the expiry date. This can be very useful to avoid any issues that may arise due to an expired key.
fields.summary: Atlassian organization admin API key expiry notification

fields.description:
At the moment, the user creation api is provided by POST /rest/api/3/user endpoint. This endpoint currently generates inconsistent results and there are no additional create options available. 

It would be useful to have additional advance options when managing users via API.

- Set if the new user has site access or not (inactive)
- Choose a product access to grant for new user
- Change the product access, site access status of an existing user.
fields.summary: Allow a more advanced API feature for managing users in the site.

fields.description:
h4. Use case

If we deactivate a user account, the user role is no longer editable.

As a site admin, I would like to have the option to edit the user role even if the user has deactivated a user account.
h4. Workaround

Reenable the user to edit's its role or remove the user from the site.
fields.summary: It is not possible to change a deactivated user's user role.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you happen to have an organization admin that is outside the site-admin and you try to change the role it will give an error in the UI and 403 in the browser console.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have an organization admin that doesn't have the site-admins group
# Try to change the role for that user to site administrator.

h3. Expected Results

The site-admins group would be added to the user and the role change to site administrator.

h3. Actual Results

The browser console will spill out the following error:

{noformat}
{status: 403, message: "Trying to access a resource with no permission", errorCode: "NO_PERMISSION"}
errorCode: "NO_PERMISSION"
message: "Trying to access a resource with no permission"
status: 403
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Add the site-admins group manually to that account.
fields.summary: Can't change role of an organization admin that is not in the site-admin group

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users with an @ symbol at the start of their names are unable to create sites

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change your Atlassian Account's Full Name to any string starting with a {{@}} symbol. e.g.: {{@John Doe}}
# Go to [WAC|https://atlassian.com/try] and try to create a new trial/site
# You'll be redirected to a page where you need to input your work e-mail address.
# Type in your e-mail address.
# A red message will be displayed stating that: "Oops, an Atlassian account with this email already exists. If you are the owner of this account, please login to continue."
# Click on *login to continue*.

h3. Expected Results
The site understands you're now logged in and lets you create the site.

h3. Actual Results
It redirects you to the same page, entering into a loop.

h3. Workaround
Remove the {{@}} symbol from your full-name on https://id.atlassian.com
fields.summary: Users with an @ symbol at the start of their names are unable to create sites

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Request to update ore public document https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/password-policies-938859739.html > Under the section "Choose when to apply changes"

h3. Expected Results
Please update the public document "Choose when to apply changes" under IMMEDIATELY, the number of days that we set for Password Expiry, will be calculated from the last date the user has changed his password.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Navigate to https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/password-policies-938859739.html > "Choose when to apply changes" > Immediately

h3. Actual Results
Currently, the document says that "users will be logged out their current session and will need to set a new password at next log in regardless of whether their existing password already met the new password policy" this seems misleading because the password expiry day will get calculated from the last password change date, but not Immediately.

h3. Workaround
Trigger the Reset password at the bottom of that *Organization* > Security > Password policies
fields.summary: Update the Public Document

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you will send invite to any user for yur Cloud site, the user will see an image not rendering the invitation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send invite to any user for your Cloud site
 # Check with the user, he will see a broken image(maybe avatar) in the email

h3. Expected Results
The image should be rendered in the email

h3. Actual Results
The email looks like the one attached.

h3. Workaround
NA
fields.summary: Image in user invite is not rendered

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some Atlassian Accounts created via User Provisioning can't be added or found in any Projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a User Provisioning configuration with your Identity Provider (Azure is the most common service to experience this issue, but this was also reported for Okta as well)
 # Provision a few users
 # Now that the Atlassian Accounts were provisioned, try to:
 ** Add them to your *Projects > People page*
 ** Search them into *User Picker fields* of open *Service Projects*

h3. Expected Results

Users will appear in the search results.
h3. Actual Results

Users don't appear.
h3. Workaround

Disabling and enabling those affected Atlassian Accounts *Access on Site* will make these users appear correctly in those mentioned search results.

 !image-2021-02-05-17-42-36-163.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Provisioned Atlassian Accounts can't be found in the results of User Picker Fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Configuring SAML SSO with ADFS server, users need to do 2 login attempts because the first one fails with the following error message:
 "We're having trouble logging you in. There seems to be an issue with your identity provider. Wait a few moments, then try again."
 ADFS here is enabled with WAP (Web application proxy). WAP is used for securing ADFS communication, here is best practice documentation on securing ADFS:
[https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/identity/ad-fs/deployment/best-practices-securing-ad-fs]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure ADFS with WAP for SAML authentication with Atlassian.
 # Login user.

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to login in on the first attempt.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the HAR capture of the user login:
{noformat}
Request Method: GET Status Code: 403 
Destination endpoint did not match 
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Disable WAP and integrate ADFS without WAP.
fields.summary: First SAML login attempt fails when ADFS has WAP enabled.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When access is requested for a deactivated user, the access request ignores the fact that the user is no site access and shows a misleading message that the user has product access (for products with the toggle button turned on, but greyed out due to having no site access).

!Screen Shot 2021-01-27 at 1.48.21 pm.png|thumbnail!!review-access-request.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure test user, say *User B* has only *JSM* slider enabled BUT is deactivated from IdP.
 ** This shows as greyed out for the user on the site. Although the JSM access slider is greyed out, it is in the ON position. see screenshot above.

 # *User A* (this should be a basic user, not a site admin) accesses a Confluence restricted page and shares it with *User B*
 # Site admin gets a notification advising that *User A* has requested access for User B but User B has no product access.
 ** Site admin goes to the *Access Requests* page to review the request

h3. Expected Results
 * Show details of the access request with a message that shows the user is deactivated.

h3. Actual Results
 * The Review Access request shows a misleading message that *User B* has access to JSM, but In reality, *User B* has no access to JSM (because the user is deactivated)
 * !review-access-request.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Access requests show product access for deactivated users

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Customers with multiple divisions using a common domain cannot enable SSO as this impacts all the users. 
Some of these customers have a requirement that users should not use local Atlassian username/password. 
This can be met if we allow org admins to enforce the social login "Continue with Microsoft" option, but there is no option to enforce this log-in.
h3. Suggestion

Allow org admins to enforce social login for users to authenticate.
h3. Workaround

For now, there is no workaround.
fields.summary: Allow org admin to enforce "Continue with Microsoft" social login option for user authentication

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

By default Org, admins should be site-admins to the sites linked with their Organizaiton.
If an Org admin is somehow removed from the site-admins group you can't give him the same access by changing his role.

Note that it shouldn't be possible to remove an Org admin from the site-admins group but there are some occasions where it happens like a site-import that re-creates the whole instance userbase.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have an Org admin removed from the site-admins group
 # Try to change his role to *Site administrator*

h3. Expected Results

The user role should be changed and he should be added to the site-admins group.

h3. Actual Results

The change of role will fail and we can see the following error from the permisison endpoint that's called:
{code}
{"key":"badRequest","context":{"message":"Cannot remove an org admin from the site-admins group"}}
{code}

h3. Workaround

Manually add the user back into the *site-admins* group.
If that doens't work, contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact].
fields.summary: Can't change role of Org admin to Site administrator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User can authorize apps to connect to the site on their behalf but can't remove the authorization from https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/apps if they don't have site administration permission.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Authenticate as a non admin user
 # Configure the Jira Add-on on your Google Sheets
 # Access [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/apps] and try removing the authorization.

h3. Expected Results

User can remove the authorization 
h3. Actual Results

User can't remove the authorization
!Screenshot 2020-12-31 at 14.55.40.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Ask the site administrator to access the user management page > connected apps and remove the authorization
fields.summary: Users without site administration permission can't remove connected app

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users with access to Trello only cannot be filtered. The filter currently, lists users who have access to the searched product along with other products.

h3. Suggested Solution
Admins should be allowed to filter users who have access to one product e.g.Trello

h3. Why this is important
Users with access to multiple products get filter even if the admin wants the users with only access to one product to be fetched. The export option becomes laborious if there are a large number of users
fields.summary: Ability to filter users who have access to one particular product

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64087].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
User is required to audit all users every 90 days and mark users inactive if they have not used the system in the time span.

Additionally they often need to notify users prior to marking them inactive to ensure they do not require access to the system.

h3. Suggested Solution

- Filter or report that can be exported which would list all users who have not used the system in X days.
- Notification to users reminding them they have access if they have not logged into the system in Y days. 

h3. Workaround
Manually review Administration -> User management -> Users and look at "Last:" in the login details column.
fields.summary: User in-activity audit report and notification

fields.description:
h4. Issue summary
* The Access request page can easily be filled up with request even with Access request option being limited to certain domain.

h4. Current behaviour
* Admin needs to deny each request one by one.

h4. Suggested behaviour
* Have an option to bulk select, and bulk deny these requests.
fields.summary: Option to bulk deny Access requests

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, User Management page in Cloud sites allow us to invite existing users and no changes to the users happen and no message is shown warning that these users already existed. This also doesn't trigger notification to those users.

This is an issue, particularly for cases where users don't have product access. Administrations unaware that a users is already part of the system (without access) may expect that the users they invited are going to have access to the products (default access), when this is not going to happen.

h3. Suggested Solution
Show a warning when inviting users, listing users that already existed and explaining these users were not modified. This will allow administrators to know they should verify and possibly modify the users.
fields.summary: Inviting existing users should show an error message

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the MS Teams Desktop version, if you have SSO configured to access your instance, you may have a *502 error Bad Gateway Nginx*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have SSO for authentication in your Jira instance
# Go to MS Teams (desktop version)
# Add Jira Cloud to your Teams
# Try connecting with your instance.
# Once you set your user/password, the authentication should fail and show you the error message:
 !image-2020-10-30-15-24-25-104.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Everything should work like the web versions does.

h3. Actual Results

The authentication fails and show you the error message:
 !image-2020-10-30-15-24-25-104.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Authorize via the web version of the Microsoft Teams App.
fields.summary: 502 error Bad Gateway Nginx on Teams Desktop version

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Export in user management seems to hang on a large data set, but it actually just takes a very long time.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a site with more than 10,000 users, go to user management
 # Run the export
 # Choose All Users and group membership
 # Click on Download file

h3. Expected Results

The processing should finish at some point and the export file should be available for download.
h3. Actual Results

The processing takes a very long time and looks like it just hangs.

!download.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Let the process run and keep that tab open, it will take ~1 minute per 1,000 users. For 10,000 users that's ~10 minutes.
fields.summary: Export in user management takes a long time on a large data set

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to log in using the "Continue with Microsoft" button after the user has had their email changed in Azure, the user is presented with an error "We're having trouble logging you in".

In the browser console we can see the error
{noformat}
unknown-handleUnlinkedExtIdpUsers
{noformat}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to id.atlassian.com
 # Click Continue with Microsoft

h3. Expected Results

You are logged in with the new email address linked to your Atlassian account
h3. Actual Results

You get an error "We're having trouble logging you in"
h3. Workaround

Log in using email and password. - [https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword]
fields.summary: Users who change their email in Azure AD cannot login

fields.description:
{panel:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}
(!) As this issue does not stop the G Suite integration but the account update that is being pushed, it is more appropriated to track this as an enhancement request to improve the UI messages so the admins know the accounts involved in the difficulty. The development team is already aware of this difficulty. We will set this ticket to _Long Term Backlog_.

For future cases, please track the progress around the enhancement request at the ticket below:
- [Improve the error handling with Org-level G Suite integration|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ACCESS-962]

Thanks.
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary
The new org-level G Suite/G Sync integration fails when trying to update a synced account to an email address that is already taken. In the UI the admins only see:
!image.png|thumbnail!

The image does not explain the issue and gives no workaround for the admins. There is a [feature request|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ACCESS-962] to improve that error message.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup the integration and sync a user (i.e. email@domain.com)
# Create a new Atlassian Account with a different email address (i.e. new.email@domain.com) but do not sync it
# At G Suit admin page, change the synced account from email _email@domain.com_ to _new.email@domain.com_

In this scenario we have the following accounts:
||account||email||synced from Google?||
|A|email@domain.com|(/)|
|B|new.email@domain.com|(x)|

h3. Expected Results
The integration should change the account _B_ email to _new.email+conflict@domain.com_ or at least let the admin opt for that change before proceeding. Then update account _A_ to _new.email@domain.com_ as G Suite should be the source of truth for the accounts. 

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens and the sync seems to fail. 

In the backend the support team can see the following errors in the logs:
Error
{code}
stack_trace: io.atlassian.micros.gsyncv2.clients.IedaException: Call to IEDA failed due to: emailalreadyexists
{code}
Message
{code}
Could not update user for directory <directoryId> and userId <userId> (status: 409, reason: {"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"status":"409","scimType":"uniqueness","detail":"Resource [USER]: with email[<targetEmail>] already exists."})
{code}

h3. Workaround
# Open a support ticket
# If the admins know about changes being pushed to our end, they can undo them at Google (i.e. revert _new.email@domain.com_ to _email@domain.com_) and then:
## Change the account with the target email to something different i.e. _new.email@domain.com_ to _invalida@domain.com_ (change just the email prefix so the account will still be managed by your Org)
## Then try to push the changes from Google (i.e. change _email@domain.com_ to _new.email@domain.com)
fields.summary: Org-level Gsync/G Suite showing error message after failing in update a user's email address.

fields.description:
By default, [the session duration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/session-duration-management-976763148.html] is set to 30 days when an organization is created and a [domain is verified|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html].

As the duration is related to the user being idle, 30 days is considered a long time for a user to be axctually logged out and changing it would require manual interacton.

This is a suggestion to lower the default value for the session duration for a different value, like 7 days so idle users can have their session terminated faster.
fields.summary: Change default value for session timeout

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Admins can use the Reset passwords button at Security > Password management to force logout all users.

This feature does not work consistently and, sometimes, doesn't log out all users.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to your organization at the [admin hub|https://admin.atlassian.com]
# Go to Security > Password management
# Scroll down and click Reset passwords

h3. Expected Results
All users should have their active sessions revoked

h3. Actual Results
Some users continue logged in

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
Since the feature is not consistent, you can try to click the button again.
fields.summary: Reset password button to force-logout all users not working consistently

fields.description:
It would be awesome to have the ability to disable that option to allow users under the domain from the user that is being invited as shown on the image below:

 !inviteAllowingDomain.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Disable the option to allow custom domain on invite

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion

Raising this feature request for the ability to notify the user when a password change is required in Gsuite.
h3. Why this is important

When users a synced via Gsuite and if a users password needs to be reset in Gsuite, then the user will not be able to access admin.atlassian.com until the password is changed.
fields.summary: Ability to notify the user when Jira verifies that a password change is required in Gsuite for the user

fields.description:
Currently, on Cloud, users can [request access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/specify-how-users-get-site-access-744721636.html#Specifyhowusersgetsiteaccess-Accessrequests] to specific products on the Atlassian Site.

+Nevertheless, the option to "add a note" when a user requests this access is *optional*.+

As a site-admin, it would be great to have that field as required and have the option to fill it up with important information, in order to provide some direction in the "Add a note" section so that users can provide context about that access and that site-admins can better understand it to assign them to the appropriate user group.
fields.summary: Require the "add a note" section when a user requests access to a certain Atlassian product

fields.description: As a user, I would like to have the option to set different default groups for Self Sign Up. And in addition to that, I would like to be able to previously set in which group the user will be added depending on the domain.
fields.summary: Allow user to set different default groups depending on domain in Self Sign Up

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a new user is joining a product and if there are no remaining licenses for that product, automatically revoke access from the user who hasn't accessed the product for the longest time, ie free up the license for a new user by auto-revoking access from a user who is least likely to need it based on their creation and last seen date.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the functionality to revoke the license of the user who did not access the product for the longest time. This comes in handy when the license limit is reached and the admin wants to add a new user.

h3. Why this is important
This allows admins to better manage the users and provide licenses.
fields.summary: When license limit is reached revoke the license of the user who did not access the product for the longest time

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user's [managed account is deactivated|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/deactivate-a-managed-account-961259517.html] while being managed by an Org when the domain is unclaimed the user can't reactivate it on their own.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Verify a domain
 # [Deactivate an account|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/deactivate-a-managed-account-961259517.html]
 # Remove the domain claim
 # Try to authenticate to the account to see the message below but then, nothing happens:
 !image.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to reactivate the account as long as they have access to the email address mailbox.
h3. Actual Results

The users see the message in the image above and nothing happens. It is locked out from its account.
h3. Workaround
If possible, reclaim the domain and activate the accounts in question.
If not, open a [support ticket with us|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/].
fields.summary: Users can't reactivate their Atlassian Accounts when they were deactivated when it was managed by an Organization.

fields.description:
h2.Problem
Currently, it is not possible to bulk delete Atlassian managed accounts.

h2.Suggestion
It would be very helpful to have a REST API option to bulk delete managed accounts.
fields.summary: REST API to bulk delete managed accounts

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Admins would like to get notified when the license limit is reached
Currently admins only become aware that all licences are used up when they receive support requests/emails from users who are getting licence errors when attempt to access product. It would be helpful if Admins were notified before all licenses are used up, so they can provision additional licences before users start encountering errors.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the functionality to notify admins when the license limit of a product is almost reached.
Notifications should be triggered when X spare licences are remaining, X being a value configurable by admins.

h3. Why this is important
It would help admins to better control licenses if they are notified.
fields.summary: Ability to notify admins when license limit is being reached

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a Site-Admin makes changes to their Product Access Settings (https://admin.atlassian.com/s/<CLOUD ID>/apps) the page does not automatically refresh to show the changes that were made

When adding a New Group to a Product, a modal briefly appears in the lower left, however, if a Group is Added/Removed as a Default Group on a Product, no notification is shown

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a popup message when a Group is Added/Removed as a Default Group and in that popup message tell the Site-Admin to refresh the page to see their changes 

Ideally, the page would refresh automatically when a change is made

h3. Workaround 
Manually refresh the page after changes are made
fields.summary: Refresh the Page when Changes are Made in Product Access Settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Disconnecting Gsuite from the Org leaves a Dead Gsync link 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Disconnect Gsuite
 # Try connecting the Org over User provisioning or Try a Transfer product n the Org
#  The above actions will not work as there is a Dead Gsuite connection on Atlassian end

h3. Expected Results

Once Gsuite is Disconnected by the Org Admin, al it's associated links should get disconnected

h3. Actual Results

In some cases this doesn't happen. When we run an API against the Org, we see a Gsync connection

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
"errors": [

{ "error": "iedaDirectoryGroupAlreadyExists" }
],
"status": "successful",
"hasReport": false
},
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Contact Atlassian to fix this from backend
fields.summary: Disconnecting Gsuite from the Org leaves a Dead Gsync link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users included in a group with *Administration Access* to Jira, but, no *Product Access* will be able to access Jira, although only specific information will be available for the user (I.E. list of projects). When in other applications (like Confluence), Jira will not visible in the application navigator as well.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As a Cloud administrator, create a group, for example, "admin-group"
 # Go to the site administration/user management ([https://example.atlassian.net/admin]) and select *Product Access*.
 # Select *Administration access* and add the "admin-group" to the *Jira* part. Make sure that this group is not included in the *Product access* option for Jira.
 # Add a test user to this group. Make sure that the user is only part of this group and no other groups with access to Jira.
 # Have the user trying to access Jira.

h3. Expected Results

The user should not be able to access Jira. From the *Administration access* page in user management, it states the following:
{quote}Groups in Jira administration don't count towards your product license, so when you want these groups to use Jira, you need to grant them product access.
{quote}
h3. Actual Results

The user is able to access Jira, but, only limited information is available. Jira will not be listed in the application navigator as well.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: User that has only administration access can access Jira and view limited information

fields.description: It would be great if Site admin's are provided with the ability to set the user name of the users while inviting to the site from the user administration page.
fields.summary: Ability to set the user names when inviting the user to site

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User with Atlassian account deleted in showing on user picket fields (assignee, reporter, etc) as accountId only and it should be showing "Former user".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
After the Atlassian account is completely deleted, access an issue that the same user was the assignee.

h3. Expected Results
Show the user as "Former user".

h3. Actual Results
It is showing as account id:
 !image-2020-09-30-09-58-52-374.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: User with Atlassian account deleted is showing on user picket fields as accountID, not "Former user"

fields.description:
The article to invite and remove users (https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/invite-and-remove-users-744721624.html) is great and covers a lot of inquiries from customers! 

However, having some information on the invitation expiration time could help to avoid cases being raised when an invitation is not working due to the invitation time being expired.
fields.summary: Add Invitation expiration time to the invitation article

fields.description:
*Problem:*

The new user role "Trusted User" is insufficient since it does not allow for real user management, and just allows them to invite users.

*Suggestion:* 

Allow additional settings for a site admin to enable Trusted Users to:

1. Maintain User Groups and assign users to groups.

2. Allow trusted users to search for users in an instance.

3. Allow Trusted users to reinstate access to inactive users.
fields.summary: The new user role "Trusted User" is insuficcient ...

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira will not create the approved domain accounts if there is no default application access enabled.
 !Screen Shot 2020-09-23 at 16.27.49.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Jira to "Approve the following domains" at htts://instance.atlassian.net/admin/signup;
# Disable all the default application accesses at htts://instance.atlassian.net/admin/apps;
# Try to self sign up with the approved domain.

h3. Expected Results
The account is created without any application access and the user is automatically redirected to the customer portal.

h3. Actual Results
The account is not created and the following page is presented.
 !Screen Shot 2020-09-23 at 16.41.29.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* Enable one of the application accesses and then remove from the users;
OR
* Subscribe to [Atlassian Access|https://www.atlassian.com/software/access] and configure the [User Provisioning|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/user-provisioning-959305316.html] to create the accounts without any application access.
fields.summary: Approved domain accounts are not created if there is no default application access enabled

fields.description:
Currently, the option "Notify all site admins when a new user joins with an approved domain" is only available to turn off when "Approve any domain" is selected.

!image-2020-09-22-10-20-38-608.png|thumbnail!

As a site-admin, I would like to turn off this option for "Approve the following domains" and "don't approve any domain" also, to avoid receiving lots of email during the day.
fields.summary: Allowing the Admin to turn all email notifications for Direct Access off if they want

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There's an inconsistency regarding "Default Access Groups" with the API and UI. You are able to delete these groups via the API, but not the UI.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # DELETE "Default Access Group" (aka `jira-software-users`) via the API

h3. Expected Results

You are given a 403 indicating you're not able to delete a default access group.
h3. Actual Results

The default access group is deleted. If you attempt to do this via the UI, you are prevented from doing so. This is an inconsistency.
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Deleting a default system group is allowed via the API but not UI

fields.description:
If your website has log in with Google/GitHub/Facebook/etc please please please make log in and sign up separate workflows.

If I attempt to log in using a provider I haven't registered with don't just automatically create a new account.

I don't want to have 5 accounts with you because I can't remember if I used Google (and which Google account if I did), Facebook, or Email/Password to register in the past.

Or at the very least make it easy to merge/delete accounts!
fields.summary: Separate the login and sign up pages for clarity

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When multiple id.atlassian.com instances are open across multiple browser tabs cant login getting "Oops, you've made a malformed request" error
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have multiple inactive [https://id.atlassian.com/] tabs open
 # Open one of the [https://id.atlassian.com/] inactive tabs to login

h3. Expected Results

To be able login successfully
h3. Actual Results

Receive an error "Oops, you've made a malformed request" and can't log in

The below exception is thrown in Splunk log:
{noformat}
'state' query parameter returned from Auth0 does not match CSRF cookie value.
Failed to authenticate user
Credential not found
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

 Close all the inactive tabs and open a new tab to login

If the user must have every login tab opened:
 # pick a tab with the login page on it - preferably the confluence one
 # Refresh that page (it’ll pick up the new CSRF token)
 # Log in
 # *Only once they have completed login on that tab* and are returned to confluence should they move to the other tabs and refresh the page
 # The page should automatically log the user in and take them to the continue param if the URL doesn’t contain prompt=login or email query parameters
fields.summary: When multiple id.atlassian.com instances are open across multiple browser tabs cant login getting "Oops, you've made a malformed request" error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user shares an issue with external users not registered on the site, the user receives an invitation regardless of the admin.atlassian.com settings where that action is locked.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a story
 # Share the story with someone outside the site.
 !image-2020-09-09-10-58-32-437.png|width=400,height=200! 

h3. Expected Results

Add the capability to disabled share.issue.shortcut feature that is the workaround for the server version. 
 Or definitely ignore those invitations raise through this action.
h3. Actual Results

The new user receives an invitation to join the site. It seems to be this action was the result of the fixing of the following bug:
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-73029
 Where instead of automatically registering the new user, it was changed to just receive an invitation.
h3. Workaround

NA
fields.summary: Sharing stories sends an joining invitation regardless the admin hub settings

fields.description:
When clicking on "Join them now" in the invitation email, provide the set of instruction to login from different browsers and provide options to choose the browser. Currently as per design it will choose the default OS preferred browser however Having to choose would be a great option because sometimes opening in Internet Explorer did not render a valid result for cloud site. 

!image-2020-09-07-14-36-49-366.png|width=502,height=250!
fields.summary: Add steps to login in the invitation email.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Cannot change a user's role "Error changing role, something went wrong while trying to change the role"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to admin.atlassian.com > users
# Find a user 
# Try to modify the role from Basic to Trusted

*Expected Results*: Able to change the user's role successfully

*Actual results*: Receive an error that something went wrong while changing the role
 !error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Sometimes this error is also received due to other reasons like the number of licensed users has exceeded the allowed limit, or when the product access had a read-only group synced via an external directory added to the product access. Reach out to support to confirm if you are hitting this bug 

h3.Workaround
Reach out to support to confirm if you are hitting this bug and we will help to apply a fix from our end
fields.summary: In few customer sites cannot change a user's role "Error changing role, something went wrong while trying to change the role"

fields.description:
h3. Description 
Under G Suite configuration it would be nice to have the information of who is the G Suite admin(the user who has set the integration) and when it was created.

h3. Use case
As it stands right now if the G Suite admin access is revoked then the sync will stop working. In scenarios like that, it would be useful if we know who is the admin so we can check their permissions.

h3. Suggestion
Under G Suite configuration display the name/email of the owner of the integration and the creation date.
fields.summary: Display details about G Suite admin

fields.description:
Suggestion:

Need Auth 0 to be included as a supported IDP for User Provisioning with Atlassian cloud.

Workaround:

Customer can use the [user provisioning API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest] to create your own integration that allows you to manage users and groups.
fields.summary: Auth 0 Identity provider for User Provisioning

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Invitation failure due to Opsgenie enabled.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable *New users have access to this product* for Opsgenie
 # Try inviting a new user
 # Notice an error occurs

h3. Expected Results

Site/Trusted Admins are able to invite any user.

h3. Actual Results

Here's the error in the browser console:

{code:none}
vendors~app.d60c994c958dd10608b0-9.js:113 Uncaught (in promise) Error: 422: {
  "error": "invalid product"
}

    at vendors~app.d60c994c958dd10608b0-9.js:113
    at u (vendors~app.d60c994c958dd10608b0-9.js:113)
    at Generator._invoke (vendors~app.d60c994c958dd10608b0-9.js:113)
    at Generator.forEach.e.<computed> [as next] (vendors~app.d60c994c958dd10608b0-9.js:113)
    at n (vendors~app.d60c994c958dd10608b0-9.js:113)
    at c (vendors~app.d60c994c958dd10608b0-9.js:113)
    at nrWrapper (VM140 a839ce4e-186a-463e-821b-b3affb5f0cdb:2)
/gateway/api/engage-targeting/api/v2/user/a839ce4e-186a-463e-821b-b3affb5f0cdb/messages/external-access-requests-changeboarding/start:1 Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 409 ()
vendors~app~preload.adaef9157f434d071774-9.js:1 Feature flag service returned 400, "Incomplete KeyIdentifier=[KeyIdentifier{type=atlassianAccountId, value=}]". This request will not be retried until the user data has been changed.
{code}

h3. Workaround

Disable *New users have access to this product* for Opsgenie. 

 !Screen Shot 2020-08-31 at 13.19.53.png|thumbnail! 

Also consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Site admin cannot invite a new user if Opsgenie is included

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As a site-admin, when using the *Suggest changes* feature, it will fail with a "*Something went wrong* message if the user has never logged in to the site.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As a site-admin, [invite a user to the site|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/invite-and-remove-users-744721624.html].
# Make sure that the user will not log-in or accept the invite.
# Go to the site's administration (I.E. https://examplesite.atlassian.net/admin) and tap the user's profile.
# On the right side, tap the *Suggest changes* button and fill it with a name/email address.

h3. Expected Results
An email should be sent to the user.

h3. Actual Results
A "*Something went wrong*" message is triggered on the bottom left:

!wrong.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Have the user accepting the invite/accessing the site prior to suggesting the change.
fields.summary: "Suggest changes" for a user that never accessed the site results in "Something went wrong"

fields.description:
Currently when a user has google id associated and uses the option "Continue with Google" to login on id.atlassian.com, the Google attributes over writes the attributes (firstname, lastname) defined for the user at id.atlassian.com.

Since we do not have a Way to restrict the login with Google option for the managed users, we need to find a way to restrict the overwriting of the attributes from Google to Atlassian's Identity platform so that the Org Admins can define these Attributes for Managed Accounts
fields.summary: Restrict the attributes passed by the Google while doing a "Login with Google"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Include users in no group export when group membership is checked
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Site Administration > Users > Export Users
 # Select USERS -> All users on the site
 # Select USER STATUS -> All users
 # Select ADDITIONAL DATA -> Group membership
 # Press "Download File"

h3. Expected Results

In the export, the users who are not present in any group should still be listed
h3. Actual Results

In the export, the users who are not in any group, are not listed
h3. Workaround
 # Export all users and their group membership (using the steps above)
 # Export a second file of All users (do *NOT* select the ADDITIONAL DATA -> "Group membership" option)
 # Compare the second file to the first file to identity users who are not in a group
fields.summary: Include users in no group export when group membership is checked

fields.description:
Currently, although the *Based In* field is available on the Org Admin UI (accessing a managed account, and clicking on *Show more details*), this information is not pulled on the export CSV, neither retrievable via API.

This information can be crucial to customers that have a centralised Organisation on Cloud, however have different offices around the globe and would like to calculate/identify which office is consuming more licenses on our products.
fields.summary: Include the Based In field on the Managed accounts CSV export

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
"Last Activity" for Confluence is not updated

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a Confluence instance and check the recent activities
# Navigate to the user management screen and click one of the users found in 1
# Check the "Last Activity" of Confluence

h3. Expected Results
The date confirmed in 1 is shown

h3. Actual Results
The date is not updated

h3. Notes
This stopped getting updated on July 22nd
 
h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Last Activity" for Confluence is not updated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you integrate your Instance with G Suite, all your verified domains on Google, become verified on your Organisation too. As a consequence, all the Atlassian accounts under these domains, become managed by the Organisation. However, Org admins aren't able to deactivate these accounts, on the Org management. Removing the account from the sync would revoke access on the Instance(s), but the account itself would remain active.

(!) This bug only affects the site level sync.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access [https://admin.atlassian.com|https://admin.atlassian.com/]
 # Click on the Organisation name.
 # Navigate to *Directory > Managed accounts* on the sidebar.
 # Click on a user.

h3. Expected Results

Admins should be able to deactivate managed accounts.
h3. Actual Results

The deactivate account button is greyed out.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: G Suite sync doesn't allow administrators to deactivate managed accounts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On Gsuite the *Next scheduled sync* is showing an incorrect date after a Manual Sync has been done
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enter the Gsuite screen and run a Manual Sync

h3. Expected Results

The next scheduled sync should show the correct date 4 hours after the manual Sync is over.
h3. Actual Results

It shows an incorrect date here:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

*But this does not affect the automatic sync from Gsuite that triggers every 4 hours*
fields.summary: Next scheduled sync showing incorrect Date

fields.description:
At this moment, the _idle session duration_ parameter is only enforced on Jira Cloud and Confluence Cloud.

With the addition of Trello users to Atlassian Access (and the organization), it would be great if the same session duration parameter that is defined in the organization will be applied to Trello as well
fields.summary: Impose the org session duration on Trello users as well

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In big organizations, almost daily there are users out of the office for vacations or any reason. It'll be great that if users have the ability to set their profile with this status preventing other people assigns work to them. Also, Jira shouldn't send a notification to these users preventing them from being blocked by the Atlassian server because of the unavailability of the Mailbox.
h3. Expected Results

Add the following option:
 Profile->Status->Available, or OOO.
h3. Actual Results

Users receive notifications and are assigned to tasks even they are not working.
fields.summary: Implement Out Of Office status for users.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user starts the integration with G Suite (but doesn't finish it), the first sync would be already scheduled. In this case, the sync would happen later, even though the integration wasn't finished. This is confusing, once according to the progress bar on the top of the integration dialog, the last step would be the *confirmation*, and therefore the sync shouldn't be scheduled before that:
 !image-2020-07-15-16-18-57-536.png|width=457,height=96!

However, once the first step is completed (authenticating to the G Suite admin account and authorising the integration), the sync is already scheduled to happen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access your Organisation.
 # Click on *Directory > G Suite*, on the sidebar.
 # Click on *Set up G Suite*.
 # Click on *Connect to G Suite*.
 # Authenticate to your G Suite admin account.

h3. Expected Results

The sync shouldn't be scheduled until the user configures it accordingly, and confirms it.
h3. Actual Results

The sync is scheduled.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Starting the G Suite integration will schedule the first sync even if the user doesn't finish the integration

fields.description:
h4. Problem Definition
At the moment, when exporting organization members via the "Export Accounts" function under managed accounts, it does not include the Department and Location information of the users.

h4. Suggested Solution
Provide the Ability to include the Department and Location information when exporting organization members via the "Export Accounts" function under managed accounts.

h4. Workaround
None at the moment.
fields.summary: Ability to include the Department and Location information when exporting organization members via the "Export Accounts" function under managed accounts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When accessing the Recent devices, we can see some of the IPs here referencing the IPs from Cloudfront. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access to https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/security/recent-devices
 # And check the Ips for example 130.176.99.89

h3. Expected Results
The recent devices should show the IPs on the user side. 

h3. Actual Results
The recent devices should show the IPs from Cloudfront.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The IPs of recent device is incorrect

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The GSuite configuration page on the cloud site is failing to load with the error.

 !Error.png|thumbnail! 

Something went wrong
G Suite configuration could not be retrieved.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the cloud site user management
 # Access the GSuite configuration page 

h3. Expected Results

The GSuite configurations should load. 

h3. Actual Results

Something went wrong
G Suite configuration could not be retrieved.

h3. Workaround

The sync should still be happening in the backend.
fields.summary: GSuite admin page is failing to load

fields.description:
It would be great if org admin or site admin can control the email while disconnecting and connecting the Gsuite to atlassian.

The email will create an unnecessary annoyance for the end-user.
fields.summary: Email notification control while adding and removing Gsuite

fields.description:
Currently, Gsuite sync happens every 4 hours and there is no way to automate the process and trigger it as per one's convenience using API calls. 

An API call would be really useful for the same.
fields.summary: API required to run GSuite sync

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 

When signing up with an umlaut character in the "Full Name" field, like ä or ü, the verification email does not correctly render the name, but instead renders the encoded version of the character, like ä
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Sign up for an Atlassian account on id.atlassian.com/signup
 # Enter name like "Fritz Hällo" 
 # Wait for verification email to arrive

h3. Expected Results

Email starts with "Hi Fritz Hällo,"
h3. Actual Results

Email starts with "Hi Fritz Hällo,"
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using umlaut in name when signing up produces incorrectly encoded name in verification email

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
For some companies, the _Manager_ of a user is important information to be displayed at the users' profile. 

h3. Suggested Solutions
Add this as an Atlassian Account field so that the users can start using that. 

side note: this would also help companies that user [user provisioning integration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/user-provisioning-959305316.html] as some Identity Providers already map this field to the users' profile. On the other hand, that field is still not working for the integration yet ([here is another feature request to include it|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ACCESS-822]).
fields.summary: Add "Manager" as a field for the Atlassian Accounts profile

fields.description:
When logging into Bitbucket, sometimes the first few characters of the SAML request headers get changed, i.e. the *referrer-policy* is set to *origin*.

The SAML authentication is affected by this change but should not be not affected by this change.
fields.summary: Modify the HTTP Referer-Policy from "same-origin" to "no-referrer-when-downgrade"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Signing with Microsoft causing the Full Name to change to Microsoft's full name

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Sign in to https://id.atlassian.com using  Continue with Microsoft

h3. Expected Results
No change in the Atlassian Account details

h3. Actual Results
Full name is changed to Mircosoft account's Full name

h3. Workaround
Use the email address and password
fields.summary: Signing with Microsoft causing the Full Name to change to Microsoft's full name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you click to edit your email in the login screen, the password field is cleaned up

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. on the log in screen, enter your email
2. click continue.
3. enter your password.
4. click to edit the email, then continue again
5. password field is cleaned up.

h3. Expected Results
Password keeps filled in

h3. Actual Results
Password field is erased

h3. Workaround
Typing the password again.
fields.summary: When clicking to edit your email in login screen, the password field is cleaned up

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Atlassian account of a provisioned user cannot be deleted
 !Screenshot 2020-05-29 at 15.20.03.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable user provisioning in the organization > managed account cannot be deleted
 !Screenshot 2020-05-29 at 15.20.03.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Atlassian account of a provisioned user should be allowed to delete

h3. Actual Results
Atlassian account of a provisioned user cannot be deleted

h3. Workaround
Remove user provisioning and then delete the Atlassian account.
OR
Disable it from the identity provider to avoid being billed.
fields.summary: Atlassian account of a provisioned user cannot be deleted

fields.description:
For the time being, it's only possible to use raw text when customizing an invite email.

It would be awesome to have the ability to use text formatting as bold text, hiperlinks, etc..
fields.summary: Customize invite email for new users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Couldn't delete a Group because the delete button is disabled, although the product doesn't exist anymore.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Access the Administration page
 # Select the Groups tab
 # Find the Group & try to delete it
 # In this case, the Group is branded as Default Access Group for an application that is no longer at the customer's cloud instance

h3. Expected Results
Have the delete button available to delete the Group

h3. Actual Results


The Group delete button is disabled although the product doesn't exist anymore

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Try to delete a Group unsuccessfully, the Delete Button is disabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

G Suite *Archived* users should not sync and be given *Has site access.*
h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Step 1*
 * Google Admin console Home page, go to Users.
 * Point your cursor at the entry for the user.
 * Click More and then Archive User.
 * Click Archive to confirm.

*Step 2*
 * G Suite admin.atlassian.com.
 * Sync now.

h3. Expected Results

G Suite *Archived* users should not sync and be given *Has site access*. It should behave the same as for *Suspended* users.

There is an API flag for Archived users.
 [https://developers.google.com/resources/api-libraries/documentation/admin/directory_v1/java/latest/com/google/api/services/admin/directory/model/User.html]
h3. Actual Results

Archived user gets synced and Has site access
h3. Workaround

Create a G Suite group with active users only and sync the group
fields.summary: G Suite Archived users should not sync and be given site access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "Recent Devices" screen is listing AWS Cloudfront IP addresses
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Validate your IP address on the Recent Devices screen [here|https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/security/recent-devices]
h3. Expected Results

Should be showing public IP address assigned by the router/ISP
h3. Actual Results

Shows AWS Cloudfront IP addresses
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The "Recent Devices" screen is listing AWS Cloudfront IP addresses

fields.description:
When trying to integrate G Suite to the Organization, the user may be prompted with below error message:

"We could not connect your G Suite Instance"
_The G Suite instance you are trying to connect has already been connected to an organization._

One of the possible causes of this issue, is if a domain which is verified on G Suite (and therefore will be part of the sync), is already verified to the Atlassian Org (either via DNS or HTTPS).

According to [our documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/domain-verification-873871234.html], this is expected:
Because you verify your domain as part of your integration with Google, you can't verify your domain from your site. If you want to verify your domain, you'll need to disconnect the G Suite integration. 

However, the error message is not effective in pointing this. 

That said, it would be really useful if the error message indicates that the integration is not possible because a domain which would be part of the sync is already verified at Atlassian.
fields.summary: Improve the error message when trying to integrate the Organization with G Suite

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Provisioning users with certain application access does not add them to the default access groups for that application

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Provision a user from an external IDP. The user is part of a provisioned group that grants access to a certain application

h3. Expected Results
If the user is granted access to that application (via the group membership), then the user should also be added to the default application access group for that application (_jira-users_ or _confluence-users_ by default)

h3. Actual Results
The user is only part of the provisioned group, hence having access to the application, but not to the bits that are protected by additional permissions granted to the default access groups

h3. Workaround

Manually adding each user to the default application access group
fields.summary: Provisioning users with certain application access does not add them to the default access groups for that application

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the site-admin uses the "Suggest changes" feature in the user management page they are presented with the error "Something went wrong".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to [https://instance.atlassian.net/admin/|https://instance.atlassian.net/admin/users]
 # Click "Show details" next to the user you want to suggest changes
 # Click "Suggest changes"
 # Type a new name and email address
 # Click Suggest changes

h3. Expected Results

It should send an email to the user with the new name and email address that was suggested
h3. Actual Results

The message "Something went wrong" is displayed
h3. Workaround

No available workaround
fields.summary: Suggest changes feature in user management throws an error message

fields.description:
{panel:title= Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes. You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

When you try to login to an existing account with the *Continue with Microsoft* button for the first time, you possibly will be asked to verify your email address. However, the email doesn't send out.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

The detailed condition is not known.
h3. Expected Results

Verification email doesn't reach out to the user due to a SendGrid error. Or even Atlassian doesn't need to verify the email because it's an existing account.
h3. Actual Results

When an existing Atlassian account tries to login with Microsoft, the account can be connected like the Google integration.

h3. Workaround

Login with your email address and password.
fields.summary: Microsoft verification email fails to deliver

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to read the QR code from Atlassian Account 2FA using https://authenticator.cc/ chrome extension, the QR code reading does not work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install https://authenticator.cc/ in your browser;
 # Try to set up the 2FA by reading the QR code.

h3. Expected Results

The set up will continue normally.

h3. Actual Results

The QR code reading fails.

h3. Workaround

Manually add the values to https://authenticator.cc/ instead of reading the QR Code.
fields.summary: Atlassian Account 2FA QR code does not work with Authenticator.cc plugin
